isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - GENERAL PROCEDURES - GEAR SET INFORMATION (DRIVE PINION AND RING GEAR MARKS)

svcproc.title: GEAR SET INFORMATION (DRIVE PINION AND RING GEAR MARKS)

note.para: Before a new gear set is installed in the carrier, read the following information. Always check the gear set for correct marks to make sure the gears are a matched set. The locations of the marks are shown in Figure 52.

step2.para: Examples of gear set part numbers:

item.para: Generoid ring gear, 36786 K or 36786 K2.
Generoid drive pinion, 36787 K or 36787 K2.

note.para: The last digit in part numbers for Generoid gears is a letter or letter and number.

step2.para: Location on Drive Pinion: End at threads.
Location on Ring Gear: Front face or outer diameter.
Example of a tooth combination number: 5-37.

note.para: A 5-37 gear set has a 5-tooth drive pinion and a 37-tooth ring gear.

step2.para: Location on Drive Pinion: End at threads.
Location on Ring Gear: Front face or outer diameter.

step1.para: Rockwell drive pinions and ring gears are available only as matched sets. Both gears of a set have a match number.

step2.para: Example of a gear set match number: M29.

note.para: A gear set match number has any combination of a number or letter and number.

step2.para: Location on Drive Pinion: End of gear head.
Location on Ring Gear: Front face or outer diameter.

step1.para: The pinion cone variation number is not used when checking for a matched gear set. The number is used when you adjust the depth of the pinion in the carrier. Refer to ADJUST THICKNESS OF SHIM PACK FOR THE PINION CAGE.

step2.para: Examples of pinion cone variation numbers: PC+3, PC-5, +2, -1, + .01 mm or -.02 mm ( Figure 53).

figure.caption: Figure 53. Pinion Cone Variation Number Location

step2.para: Location on Gear Set: End of pinion gear head or outer diameter of ring gear ( Figure 53).
